name: Eriodictyon

Head: Pain in ears
Coryza with dizziness and sneezing
Burning in throat
Coryza
Dizzy, feels intoxicated
Foul mouth in morning
Pressure outwards; worse, occiput
Respiratory: Chronic bronchitis, bronchial tuberculosis, with profuse, easily raised bronchial secretion, giving relief
Wheezing; asthma, with coryza and mucous secretions
Male: Sore, dragging in testicle, could not bear any pressure; better gentle support

details: A remedy for asthmatic and bronchial affections. Bronchial phthisis, with night-sweats and emaciation. Asthma relieved by expectoration. COUGH AFTER INFLUENZA. Furthers absorption of effusion in plural cavity. Appetite poor and impaired digestion. Whooping cough.
dosage: Tincture in doses of 2 to 20 drops and attenuations.
